traceability.evidence:
The CLI parsing in src/cli-options.js supports --prod-min-age, --dev-min-age, --prod-severity, and --dev-severity (via parseProdMinAgeFlag, parseDevMinAgeFlag, parseProdSeverityFlag, parseDevSeverityFlag). The config-loader (src/config-loader.js) reads config.prod and config.dev objects and applies nested minAge/minSeverity. printOutdated (src/print-outdated.js) uses getDependencyType to tag each row as ‘prod’ or ‘dev’, and handleTableOutput includes a “Type” column.
Tests covering this functionality include: - test/functional-assessment.test.js “007.0-DEV-SEPARATE-PROD-DEV-THRESHOLDS” block, which asserts that invalid prod/dev flags error (exit 2) and valid flags run showing ‘dev’ in output. - test/cli.config-file.test.js applies prod/dev values from the .dry-aged-deps.json config and verifies obj.summary.thresholds.prod.minAge/minSeverity and dev equivalents. - test/printOutdated.prodDependency.test.js confirms that a prod dependency is labeled “prod” in table output. - test/cli.flags.test.js and other JSON/XML formatter tests show thresholds.prod and thresholds.dev values in JSON output.
traceability.notes: All acceptance criteria are met: CLI flags for prod/dev thresholds work; config file support for prod/dev works; fallback to general flags and defaults to 7 days is correct; values are validated; dependency types are detected and shown in output. The implementation is fully covered by unit, integration, and functional tests.
